cwe_description: The product reads data past the end of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code uses STRLEN(string) to determine the length of the input 'string' without explicitly ensuring that 'string' is a null-terminated string. If 'string' points to a buffer that does not contain a null terminator within its allocated bounds, STRLEN (which is typically a macro for strlen) will read past the end of the buffer until a null byte is encountered or an invalid memory access occurs. This leads to an out-of-bounds read, which can result in a crash (denial of service) or potentially information disclosure by reading unintended memory contents.
